review: With peaceful courtyard and beautiful landscapes, this place is worth a visit. This place has a beautiful monasteryand one can also see some Tibetan style homes.  Do meet the happy,  cute puppy-trolla here.

title: happy valley makes the traveller really happy
review: Happy valley is the view which can be witness from the temple . The view we get from the tenple is called happy valley. A must visit place to really have a look at the sky clouds greenery mountains trees temple .. in short everything is just so beautiful from here . Make sure to enjoy the view once in mussoorie. There is also a buddhist school with so many friendly kids who offer a helping hand and welcome the travellers with an open arms ..

title: Outing
review: Very nice atmosphere suitable for couple and family awesome experience excellent services with all facilities

title: Peace.. and good views
review: This is a Buddhist temple so you will definitely feel the peace and the area is surrounded by a lot of greenery, so the views are good.

title: Happy Valley-  1 st place in India  where Dalai Lama Set his foot.
review: It is supposed to be the first place when The Revered Dalai Lama set his foot when he reached India from TIBET. There is a statue of Lord Buddha  where people tie scarves or  thin  flag like cloth  to fulfil their wishes, so that just as the wind blows it will carry a strand of thread to far of places  which will help to spread their religion far and wide.

title: half day trip from Musoorie
review: Just two hours slowly walking to Happy Valley and you feel like in other space. Tibet, open space, beautiful view. I loved to sit on the top and just watch, meditate....

title: Must Visit place for peace lovers
review: The temple is located 4km from spring road.  The way to the temple just like entire mussourie lacks signboards.  The temple complex is beautiful,  clean and properly maintained. The scenic beauty is also great. The temple also has prayer wheels. Outside main temple,  their is a stairy pathway with around 100 or more stairs leading to idol of Gautam Budha.  The scenery at the top is worth the stairs.

title: Serene
review: We spent three hours of peace at this beautiful place. Silently watching Tibetan followers in prayer was magical. You won’t necessarily need three hours but we found it to be peaceful and spiritual. Well worth the trip from Mussoorie.

title: Nice place
review: Happy Valley is famous for Tibetan School and Monastery. Place is nice, calm and beautiful. Tibetan school is very old and is resident to Tibetan refugees. One must visit this place. Also Monastery is worth a visit.

title: peaceful and enjoyment
review: it is like a mini tibbat. buddha temple is very great. not much crowed. you should visit here if you have some spare time

title: A. Reason To Go when you know,
review: The valley is a small western portion of Mussooire entered to the Right of The library. It is a narrow road frequented by taxis and humans.  Best to take a taxi unless you want to  exercise.  Near the end of the road you would have passed a few hotels, e.g. The Carlton Plaisant.  T the end you will have  entered a small Tibetan area..beautiful temple,  school  and not to be  missed a walk up to and/or  out to the 100 ' s Tibetan Prayer flags. ..what a sea of colours. To the east the valleys and if lucky i. e. blue sky the Himalayan Range.

title: Best For nature Lovers
review: Happy valley is famous for housing IAS Academy,tibetan temples and the Municipal garden.Apart from these,tourists can also take walk to the Kala School from Happy Valley which leads to Hathipaon Park estate.

title: natural beauty
review: when you will visit there you will feel you are in tibbet.. a must visit place if you want to know about tibbet culture.. very peaceful place and buddha temple was just awesome

title: worth a visit for the views
review: you get awesome views from the frontage of the monastery.. less crowded . its worth a visit..and hanging around during sunny day

title: Beautiful place but not maintained
review: I came here with my friends. I love to come to Mussoorie, this one of my favorite place to visit whenever I get time. This time I visited Buddha temple in happy valley. First I was very excited but I went there I loved the place with a little disappointed. Temple is on the top of hill you can see the view of Mussoorie, MIS, kempty . You will get the 360 view from the temple . I  disappointed because on the way of temple I saw so many beer bottle which were broken and lots of wrappers of food , this kind of stuff should not be there as it is holy place.

title: DALAI LAMAS PLACE
review: Actually  this valley was developed by the  14th dalai lama with his pupils,people feel joyous  and happy after visiting this happy valley

title: A wow place for someone who is yet to see a monastery
review: This place is a must visit for someone who has not see a monastery from up-close. If you can walk till here, you will enjoy the trek through LBSNAA, IAS academy.

title: The Most Beautiful Place visited in Mussoorie.
review: This was the Most beautiful place visited in Mussoorie. This was my first Monastery visit. And I liked it so much. The temple inside was filled with Peace & Spirituality. Awesome view of the Valley with few Tibetan Style homes. A small mountain walk will lead you to Buddha Temple, from which of the entire valley can be seen & its very good.

title: Peace and tranquility
review: Happy valley is abode of Tibetans and beautiful in every way. Its peaceful, away from crowds, one can have silent walk here, enjoying the tranquility of the place.

title: Little Tibet in Mussoorie
review: Happy Valley was Dalai Lama's first home in India. You have more than 5000 tibetian settled in this valley.

title: Out Beyond the Hussle n Bussle of Mussoorie
review: A wonderful place that should,be included in any trip to Mussoorie.  It was here that the Father of India one gave a major speech, and here that the Dalai Lama first came when he fled Tibet. Perhaps their Ahimsa is apart of the presence of,this area.  You will soon notice what is sometimes called Little Tibet and it's Temple and prayer flags galore. The views from the area are stunning, and it provides an exit point to George Everest's house.

title: Breathtaking
review: Happy Valley is a good excursion with the Tibetan settlement around and the Buddha Temple is just breathtaking with splendid views. Good for a long walk from the main town.

title: Peaceful little Tibet enclave
review: This is a calm and peaceful place located in Mussoorie.

title: Lovely Tibetean settlement
review: Happy Valley is a lovely Tibetean enclave situated in Mussoorie.

title: Go to see and appreciate Tibetan culture
review: This was the settlement established by Dalai Lama when he fled Tibet. There is a Buddhist temple and few Buddhist schools. The valley is lush green and dotted with houses constructed in Tibetan style and adorned with Tibetan motifs. The entire valley affords good hiking trails and one can spend a whole day here, hiking, talking to people, understanding their culture.

title: Peaceful!
review: A quiet place away from the busy streets of Mussoorie, overlooking the valley. You might want to make a small donation towards the temple (optional). Free entry.

title: Happy to be in Happy valley
review: We were all happy to be here as this is a most peaceful place in Mussoorie.  you will love it as it looks like mini Tibet.

title: Really Happy and Peaceful Valley
review: Its really great to spend time here with family.... very peaceful.... very close to nature.... very nice place to take photographs... must visit....

title: A little of Tibetan Buddhism on the peaks
review: What a wonderful place to visit, especially so if one is inclined  to see a little of Tibetan Buddhism here above the Doon Valley.  Do make a point of visiting the temple and be surprised by the huge prayer wheel.  The small range of Prayer Flags strung out along one of the peaks will certainly catch you atttention.

title: Most Beautiful Place I've Ever Been
review: Happy Valley is hands down one of the most beautiful places I have ever visited. The monastery is beautiful and the people are incredibly friendly. The golden buddha located on top of the hill is an incredible sight.

title: its buddhs school
review: the location is far away from the city. while going up you can visit the place. its quiet and like any other monestry

title: An Oasis of Peace and Tranquility !!!
review: Must visit place while in Mussoorie. As you enter the premises, a sense of Serenity engulfs you. You enter the sanctum and see the Priests chanting prayers... And they are tech-savvy too..reading out of their i-pads placed in front..You can sit there for some time and lose yourselves to Rediscover a new you... And the people are so friendly and simple.. once outside the temple, you can soak in the Breathtaking views of the valley..

title: Good
review: Happy Valley is an area situated within the hill station of Mussoorie in Dehradun district, Uttarakhand, India.

title: Nice calm area
review: Place is beautiful. Very good vibes around. Can sit and relax. view is nice. Wishing wheel is there too.

title: peaceful

title: Happy valley✔️
review: I love to explore new places and this place is  must go for those who love nature , cool breeze,and silence.situated near mussorie this place is surrounded by buddist flags and there is a buddha temple  which is clean and bicely maintained . The cool breeze and scenic beauty will make u fall in love with this place . Its also a good place  for the ones who love photography .

title: Wonderfull place to walk through, away the noisy city
review: What a wonderfull place. quiet, calling for meditation, rest, or whatever you are lookinf for except noise and crowd... beautifull temple and amazing place to climb to under colorfull flags, from where view on Himalayas let me breathless

title: Nothing above it!
review: Happy valley is located at, I think the highest point of Mussoorie. The view from there is breathtaking. There is a Tibetan school and it is lovely to see how all those Tibetan children live, work and study there. The paintings done by students are something you just cannot resist buying. The monastery is well maintained and so peaceful.

title: Find your inner peace!!
review: The Happy Valley lives upto its name.. people here are really happy and joyous. The place has an aura and has abundant positive vibes. do visit the Buddha statue on the hill once you are done visiting the temple. It is recommended to visit the place in the evening during the sunset as the sunset here is spectacular

title: A good walk to this spot!!

title: Silent Valley

title: Perfect for Happiness
review: You'll feel happy in the Happy Valleys; as the name suggests. The local inhabitants are the Buddhists and you can hear their enchanting hymns always.

title: Just another monastery
review: This monastery is historically important but there is nothing spectacular about it, except of course, the view of valley from there.

title: happy happy
review: Small and beautiful temple with amazing  360 view .. Th best part is that its not crowded . Definitely must visit and will love to go again

title: Happy Valley

title: Nice Place to visti
review: Over all experience was good i would like to visit again this place

title: Tranquility at its best
review: This is the best thing that happened to us at mussorie.... had to walk around 2-3 kms to reach this place... some of our friends stopped in the middle.... and those who came here with us were spell bound.. nature' beauty at its best... a small buddha temple with a valley view against it...  surrounded by tibetian household in the valley... watched sunset here among clouds... felt like in the skies. JUST DON'T MISS.

title: Tibetan Temple
review: Good if you have time. It's a small & quiet Tibetan temple, nice clear view of Hathipaon, Hills & valleys. You can sit and spend quiet time here. You can also walk up to the flag hill to get a better view from the elevated point.

title: Home for Tibetans
review: A lovely "valley" runs down between small ridges. Lal Bahadur Shastri Academy of Administration is on the NE side. The valley was once set up by McKinnon as a sporting area. There are still fields, courts and a horse grounds. At the far end is Flag Hill (Herne Hill) with a lovely view across to Benog Tibba on the other side of the large catchment area for Kempty Falls. One looks down over the large polo field as well.

title: The peace....
review: A beautiful temple, amazing view, and peaceful surroundings. A good place to sit in silence for a while or to contemplate. Must visit in Mussoorie.

title: Home away from home.
review: Happy valley is situated in quite area near Lal Bahadur Shastri National Academy of Administration.Many children can be seen here who lives in hostel for study. They are from different parts of India, some of them are from Nepal and Tibet. Children's  are very innocent. Everyone lives happily here.It's a worth visiting place.

title: Just a very interesting place to see
review: We have been here a number of times and we always see it through fresh eyes, a lot of culture as well as a fabulous view

title: People Friendly and Kindly
review: We walked by mistake through the Tibetan School and were helped along by many adults smiling and kind.  We were looking for the Tibetan Temple in Happy Valley (beautiful and peaceful).

title: Place that calling you to come again
review: Its Tibetan temple there, very colourful. Amazing view from the view point, you can see Tibetan homes and school and flags. People who like peace should visit that place for sure. Mantra cycle of life cylinders are there, so you can have an experience of Tibetan monks.

title: Ok for time pass
review: Go if you have nothing else to do or ypu have small kids who want to run around.

title: Valley view and Tibetan temple!!

title: Valley of Peace
review: A very peaceful place which was not crowded at all. There is a tibetian buddhist temple which is fantastic place to sit and meditate. The view of the valley is stunning and serene.

title: It is actually a happy valley
review: Went there with a group of friends and this place is simply amazing. The view is simply very serene. I will recommend any traveler to check out this place for sure.

title: Nice View
review: I liked view from happy valley, i like to visit again this place. People should visit this place if they have time.

title: Nice place for couples
review: Happy valley is very good place to visit. Tibatian market and temple makes us feel good. Lots of new things are seen here.

title: Great place to witness Tibetan Culture
review: We stayed around Dhanolti Mussoorie area for a couple of days, which included one day at a beautiful nature resort whispering pines at jwarna. On one of the days during our holiday, we got a chance to visit Happy Valley with a few friends who were familiar with mussoorie. Nice, photogenic place with buddhist flags all around

title: Go to find tranquility
review: Everytime I visit Mussoorie, Happy Valley is always on my list, sort of pilgrimage for me.

title: Great place
review: It is undoubtedly beautiful,you can't be unhappy watching that valley. It is huge and seems so close. It bring smile on your face. Small cafe near temple is nice and clean.you get 360 deg view of entire garhwal range.I shall come back soon with friends.

title: Nice Tibetan Place
review: Its a temple with lots of Tibetans and lovely atmosphere. We went on a special day it seems, we were offered a free prasad made out of Sattu and Jaggery with Cashews in it. And also a free packet of chips!

title: A serene pleasure
review: An apt name to begin with. I loved the name because it fits in so much. No matter how disturbed you are. Its very sure that a trip to this wonderful valley will infinetely cheer you up.

title: Enchanting tibetan oasis
review: We walked there from Mussoorie just by chance, because it's not in the Lonely Planet Guide. We saw a signal and followed a path asking people. It was a real surprise! We ended up in the Happy Valley: nice tibetan style houses scattered here and there in the emerald green of the forest, lots of nice young people/students and children walking up and down. We briefly visited the monastery: the monks were helping to restore it. Welcoming people let us to go in the school and look around: the students were rehearseling for the Dalai Lama's imminent visit. An indian teacher told us the story of the place and invited us for a tea (unfortunately we had to go back 'cause it was late and about to become dark). Oh, how I'd like to go there again!

title: gazab ki jagah hai bhai logo...
review: it was a lovely place ...cloudy ..windy...n peaceful place..to much crowed was there..every one was enloying a lot ..there with there family..our team was also enjoying a lot there.....i would say just wow..wow...wow...n wow..nice to see that place yaar..

title: very nice and well maintained tibetan area,,
review: well it's very clean and green... with all the Tibetan school student well mannered.... with a very nice view of Tibetan Temple and the surrounding....

title: An ok place
review: If you are interested to see once tibettan school and budha temple then you can visit this place not very far from mall road, the temple is ok but the scool looks really good, and scenic beauty is sort of ok from this place.

title: Tibettan houses n school
review: It's good place to visit if u r interested in tibettan houses n school. The view from the monestry is quite the same as from other spots like company garden.

title: valley of happy people
review: happy valley is the place for Tibetans settlement in mussoorie located west of mussoorie very famous dalai hill where you will see the entire range of jaunpur and nagtibba

title: Breathtaking views
review: We walked here from Mussorie Library, signposted for the most part and otherwise keep to the main road. You walk down into the valley, pass the football field and Tibetan school and then arrive at the temple. There is an explanation of the Buddhist prayer wheel and you walk past them on the way into the temple. The temple itself is of modest size. The panoramic views of the Himalayas opposite are stunning. There is a trek from here down the mountain to Lakemist and Kempty falls. Very well laid out at the start, again amazing views, less obvious which way to go toward the end but always helpful people around to point us the right way!

title: amazing experience
review: Before leaving our hotel Honeymoon Inn, we had plans of hiring a taxi/rickshaw from Library Bus Stand and  go to Happy Valley. But after enquiring a few locals about the distance and road conditions, we started to walk. We kept walking and pass by LBS IAS Training Academy on your right. Mid-way we had to hire a taxi going there as the road we took had so many speeding vehicles coming/going. The pollutants from vehicles also forced us to stop mid-way and take a cab. Before the temple, you will pass by a string of Tibetan settlements, a playground, a big school. The temple is quite welcoming. We  are interested in Tibetan culture and architecture, so we spend a good amount of time taking to some lamas roaming around. There were 1-2 other visitors as the main part of the temple was closed at the time we arrive.
